subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てき}}
Repurposed from the {{m|en|target}} meaning, probably from [[w:Ming Dynasty|Ming]]- and [[w:Qing Dynasty|Qing]]-era {{der|ja|cmn|sort=てき|-}} use of this character as a possessive or adjectivizing particle,<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> or even earlier in the [[w:Song Dynasty|Song]] and [[w:Yuen Dyanasty|Yuan]] eras.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref> Probably also influenced in the {{w|Meiji period}} by the {{der|ja|en|sort=てき|-}} adjective ending {{m|en|-tic}} (as in {{m|en|spastic}}, {{m|en|plastic}}, or {{m|en|characteristic}}), ultimately deriving from {{der|ja|grc|sort=てき|-τικός}}, used to form adjectives from verbs.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

subSections.title: Suffix
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てき}}
From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=てき|的|tr=tek|pos=literally “mark in a target”, also meaning “bright”}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|的%確|てき%かく}}: [[accurate]], [[apt]], [[exact]]
* {{ja-r|的%言|てき%げん}}: [[bon mot]], the [[right]] [[word]] or [[turn of phrase]] for the [[occasion]]
* {{ja-r|的%殺|てき%さつ}}: in {{m|ja|九星|tr=kyūsei|lit=nine stars|pos=an astrology system from ancient China}}, the [[opposite]] [[direction]] from the favored direction for one's [[age]]
* {{ja-r|的%実|てき%じつ}}: [[certain]], [[definite]], [[actual]], [[real]]
* {{ja-r|的%証|てき%しょう}}: [[accurate]] [[evidence]]
* {{ja-r|的%切|てき%せつ}}: [[fitting]], [[appropriate]]
* {{ja-r|的%然|てき%ぜん}}: [[clear]], [[distinct]]
* {{ja-r|的%中|てき%ちゅう}}: a [[hit]]; to be [[on target]]
* {{ja-r|的%屋|てき%や}}, {{ja-r|的%野|てき%や}}: a [[hawker]], a [[peddler]] of [[cheap]] and [[gaudy]] [[wares]]
* {{ja-r|的%例|てき%れい}}: an [[appropriate]] or [[fitting]] [[example]]
* {{ja-r|的%皪|てき%れき}}: [[vividly]] and [[brightly]] [[shining]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text:
* {{sense|derogatory for “he, she, it”}} {{ja-r|あいつ}}
* {{sense|derogatory for “you”}} {{ja-r|おまえ}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|まと}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=まと|-}}. Possibly originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=まと|目|tr1=ma|t1=eye|所|tr2=to|t2=place}}. Appears to be [[cognate]] with [[homophone]] {{m|ja|円|tr=mato||round|pos=adjective, obsolete in modern Japanese}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いくは}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=いくは|-}}.
* May be derived from rare archaic verb {{m|ja|いくう|tr=ikuu||to shoot [an arrow] at something|pos=archaic spelling {{ja-l|いくふ}}}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
: The ''ha'' element would presumably derive from the verb ending {{m|ja|ふ|tr=fu}}, which has a {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of ''ha''. However, this is unlikely, as verb forms ending in ''-fu'' underwent the regular ''f-'' and ''h-'' > ''w-'' shift, which would result in a reading of *''ikuwa'' rather than the correct ''ikuha''.
* The above phonetic discrepancy suggests that ''ikuha'' may instead be a compound of ''iku'' + ''ha''. The ''iku'' element probably derives from root component {{m|ja|いく|tr=iku}} meaning “shooting [arrows]”, as found in {{m|ja|いくう|tr=ikuu}} and also in {{m|ja|戦|tr=ikusa||a battle|pos=original meaning “the shooting of arrows”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The ''iku'' element might be related to verb {{m|ja|射る|tr=iru||to shoot an arrow}}, or obsolete verb {{m|ja|生く|tr=iku||to live; to make something live, to make something go}}, likely [[cognate]] with {{m|ja|行く|tr=iku||to go}}.
: The ''ha'' element is uncertain. It might be {{m|ja|端|tr=ha||the edge or end of something}}, from the sense “the end [of the arrow's flight]”.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|的%所|いくは%どころ}}: the [[location]] where an [[archery]] [[target]] is [[placed]]

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆくは}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ゆくは|-}}. Alteration of ''ikuha'' above. Compare the ''iku'' <> ''yuku'' alteration in the verb {{m|ja|行く|tr=iku, yuku||to go}}.
